message: I am thinking about starting to use ZSH on my mac what is differences between ZSH and BASH and is it worth the switch?
zsh is just cool. Check out my config framework https://github.com/myfreeweb/zshuery and don't look at this hipster oh-my-zsh project

I haven't tried @myfreeweb's stuff, but I'm a fan of oh-my-zsh, it provides pretty much everything I need. Although he's right, it can be a bit slow in some cases (I notice it when accessing large git repos).
I guess give both a try & see which you prefer ;p

I've recently switched to zsh because of oh-my-zsh and can't believe I haven't done it sooner. I use sjl's Prose http://stevelosh.com/blog/2010/02/my-extravagant-zsh-prompt/ theme with a few minor hacks of my own. Works swell on a SSD ;)
I like oh-my-zsh with the Solarized color scheme. http://ethanschoonover.com/solarized
zsh can do stuff like this http://caseybanner.ca/2011/04/11/start-using-zsh
I love zsh, I'm not sure why anyone would use bash over it. I tried oh-my-zsh but went back to my own config. Oh-my-zsh just seemed to be a bunch of themes and git integration
